description.narrative: - MTI will provide sludge treatment and odor control technology to wastewater treatment plants in China which currently are struggling to deal with their own waste products and the environmental problems they create. - MTI will transfer technology into China and adapt it for local conditions so it address local problems at a reasonable market price. The technology uses waste as a resource consistent with Chinese government guidance. - MTI will continue to provide EPC services for the growing wastewater treatment market in China. - MTI will recycle sludge into construction fill allowing for reduced use of soil

IFC is proposing an US$4 million investment in Series A preferred shares in MTI Environment Group Ltd (the Company or MTI), a Cayman Island-based company, which is a holding company for a group of US and Chinese operating companies. MTI is a leading wastewater treatment, sludge treatment and odor control design and Engineering, Procurement and Construction (EPC) company in China. MTI has been in the wastewater treatment sector for more than 10 years with a solid record of quality projects and, after acquiring BacTee, an experienced US sludge treatment and odor control company, and is moving towards being a full-service sludge and odor technical solution provider. Chinas wastewater treatment (WWT) market continues to grow strongly as China develops and urbanizes, and sludge volume has increased alongside WWT capacity. As landfill space has filled up and regulatory policy has changed to favor treating sludge as a resource, sludge treatment market is going to take off and witness accelerated growth.
